page.title: 09CONSERVATION IN BURBAGE
page.content: In recent years Burbage has grown considerably, with the result that the village has lost some of its identity. However, the historic village centre remains and has been recognised by declaring it a Conservation Area in 1973. The Conservation Area is dominated by the Parish Church of St. Catherine. A church has stood here for many centuries.Other buildings of interest are Cedar Lawns and the Constitution Club, once the home of George Canning (1770-1827),Prime Minister of Great Britain.Burbage Hall, a 17th century building, is located in Aston Lane. The Croft, a late 18th century building, is found in Church Street. This dwelling is connected with the hosiery industry. The original Horsepool has now disappeared and the land built on.
